metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3708 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Compute (Nova) before 2014.1.4 and 2014.2.x before 2014.2.1 allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via an IP filter in a list active servers API request.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3708` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nova-ajax-console-proxy - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-api - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-api-metadata - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-api-os-compute - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-api-os-volume - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-cells - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-cert - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-common - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-kvm - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-libvirt - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-lxc - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-qemu - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-vmware - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-compute-xen - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-conductor - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-console - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-consoleauth - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-network - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-novncproxy - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-scheduler - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-serialproxy - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-spiceproxy - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-volume - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
nova-xvpvncproxy - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
python-nova - 1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nova package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2015.1~b1-0ubuntu5').
